European.caption: European 4-in-1 the most basic European weave.
European.text: European weaves are inspired by weaves historically worn as armor originating in Europe. European weaves tend to have a noticible grain due ot the rings alternating direction each row. Below is a list of articles about weaves of the European family.

Japanese.caption: Japanese 4-in-1 the most basic Japanese weave.
Japanese.text: Japanese weaves are inspired by weaves historically worn as armor originating in Japan. Japanese weaves are characterized by rings joining at 90Â° degree angles and tend to be geometic. Below is a list of articles about weaves of the Japanese family.

weave.caption: The Japanese 4-in-1 weave, a very basic weave.
weave.text: In chainmail a weave is an infinitely repeating pattern and unique of rings, where each ring meaningfully contributes such that removing one ring drastically changes its characteristics.

chain.text: In chainmail a chain is a weave that is infinitely repeatable in one direction.

sheet.text: In chainmail a sheet is a weave that is infinitely repeatable in two directions that are perpendicular to each other.
